byline.original: By HERBERT L. MATTHEWS Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: Ansaldo outlines reasons why Allies will not make any move
snippet: ROME, March 31--The Italians have the impression today, following Winston Churchill's speech, that the British mean business, but they are skeptical about the Allied possibilities of action under the present circumstances....

headline.main: ITALY NOW EXPECTS ACTION BY ALLIES; But Rome Is Skeptical About Whether It Will Succeed in Present Circumstances SOVIET PACT DISCOUNTED Molotoff's Speech Is Seen as Putting to an End Talk of Accord at This Time

lead_paragraph: ROME, March 31--The Italians have the impression today, following Winston Churchill's speech, that the British mean business, but they are skeptical about the Allied possibilities of action under the present circumstances.
